Mantan Dirut PLN Divonis Bebas, IPW : Pembentukan Dewas KPK Semakin Mendesak
05 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Mantan Dirut PLN Divonis Bebas, IPW : Pembentukan Dewas KPK Semakin Mendesak

KBRN, Jakarta : Ketua Presidium Indonesia Police Watch (IPW), Neta S Pane menilai, vonis bebas terhadap mantan Direktur Utama (Dirut) PT PLN, Sofyan Basir semakin memperkuat alasan bagi undang-undang yang mengamatkan pembentukan Dewan Pengawas Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (Dewas KPK)."Dengan adanya kasus Sofyan Basir ini, IPW melihat bahwa keberadaan Dewan Pengawas di KPK semakin mendesak diperlukan, agar lembaga anti rasuah itu tidak melenceng dari sistem hukum," katanya kepada wartawan di Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Selain itu, lanjut Neta, kasus tersebut juga menunjukkan bahwa keberadaan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) sebagai penjabaran UU KPK hasil revisi juga semakin diperlukan.Â Tujuannya, imbuh dia, agar KPK dalam melakukan pemberantasan korupsi benar-benar profesional dan independen dengan berdasarkan pada alat bukti dan bukan berdasarkan voting belaka."Sehingga hasil kerja KPK benar benar berdasarkan asas keadilan dan bukan mempolitisasi, apalagi mengkriminalisasi lawan-lawan politik," tekannya.Meski demikian, diingatkannya, jika sudah dibentuk nanti, Dewas KPK harus bisa menjaga martabat dan marwah komisi anti rasuah. KPK di bawah pengawasannya haruslah bekerja secara profesional dan independen."Sehingga semua perkara yang dimajukannya ke Pengadilan Tipikor tidak ada celah untuk dikalahkan majelis hakim," pungkasnya.Sebelumnya, Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Jakarta memvonis bebas mantan Dirut PT PLN, Sofyan Basir. Sofyan yang juga merupakan terdakwa kasus dugaan pembantuan transaksi suap terkait proyek pembangunan PLTU Riau-1 itu bebas atas tuntutan Jaksa Penuntut Umum (JPU) yang ingin menjerat dia dengan hukuman penjara 5 tahun dan denda Rp 200 juta subsider 3 bulan kurungan. (Foto : Antara/ Puspa Perwitasari)

Former Managing Director of PLN Sentenced Free, IPW: Establishment of KPK Dewas Increasingly Urgent
05 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Former Managing Director of PLN Sentenced Free, IPW: Establishment of KPK Dewas Increasingly Urgent

KBRN, Jakarta: Chairperson of the Presidium of the Indonesian Police Watch (IPW), Neta S Pane considers that the acquittal of the former President Director of PT PLN, Sofyan Basir further strengthens the grounds for the law that saved the formation of the Corruption Eradication Commission Supervisory Board (Dewas KPK) "With the case of Sofyan Basir, IPW sees that the presence of the Supervisory Board at the KPK is increasingly needed, so that the anti-religious organization does not deviate from the legal system," he told reporters in Jakarta on Tuesday (11/05/2019). That, continued Neta, the case also showed that the existence of Government Regulation (PP) as an elaboration of the revised KPK Law was also increasingly needed. The aim, he added, is that the KPK in eradicating corruption is truly professional and independent based on evidence and not based on mere voting. "So that the KPK's work is truly based on the principle of justice and not politicizing, let alone criminalizing political opponents," he stressed. Even so, he reminded, if it was formed later, Dewas KPK must be able to maintain the dignity and fervor of the anti-rasuah commission. The KPK under its supervision must work professionally and independently. "So that all cases brought before the Corruption Court do not have a gap to be defeated by the judges," he concluded. Previously, the Jakarta Corruption Court sentenced the ex-PT PLN Director, Sofyan Basir. Sofyan, who is also a defendant in a case of allegedly assisting bribery transactions related to the Riau-1 PLTU development project, was free from the demands of the Public Prosecutor (JPU) who wanted to ensnare him with a sentence of 5 years in prison and a fine of Rp 200 million in a 3 month jail sentence. (Photo: Antara / Puspa Perwitasari)
